Tags: definition-interpretation python inclusion class

DefinitionInterpretationInclusion (python class)

See also

math concept | python declaration class | python sample

This section presents the DefinitionInterpretationInclusion python class.

This class models the inclusion of the definition-interpretation inference-rule in the target theory-elaboration-sequence.

Punctilious users do not need to instanciate objects from this class. In effect, the TheoryElaborationSequence class exposes the definition_interpretation property, and instanciation is automatic when this property is accessed for the first time.

class punctilious.DefinitionInterpretationInclusion(t, echo=None, proof=None)
infer_formula(definition=None, formula=None, echo=None)

This python method does not verify the validity of the arguments, applies the inference-rule algorithm, and returns a formula.

Note

Note the critical distinction between the infer_formula and the infer_formula_statement methods. The former does not verify the validity of the arguments, applies the inference-rule algorithm, and produces a formula that may be invalid . The later verifies the validity of the arguments, applies the inference-rule algorithm, and produces a formula-statement that is valid by definition.

infer_formula_statement(definition=None, formula=None, nameset=None, ref=None, paragraph_header=None, subtitle=None, echo=None)

This python method verifies the validity of the arguments, applies the inference-rule algorithm, and returns a formula-statement.

Note

Note the critical distinction between the infer_formula and the infer_formula_statement methods. The former does not verify the validity of the arguments, applies the inference-rule algorithm, and produces a formula that may be invalid . The later verifies the validity of the arguments, applies the inference-rule algorithm, and produces a formula-statement that is valid by definition.
